com.illcode.meterman.impl

Class Door

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.illcode.meterman.impl.BaseEntity
      • com.illcode.meterman.impl.Door
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Entity

    public class Door
extends BaseEntity
    A door is a special usage entity that can connect and disconnect two rooms, depending on whether it is locked.

    It maintains lists of two rooms, descriptions to be shown in each room, and messages to be shown in each room depending on whether it is locked or not.

      • setPositions

        public void setPositions(int pos1,
                int pos2)
        Sets the positions (ex. UIConstants.NW_BUTTON) in the first and second room to be connected when the door is unlocked.
        Parameters:
        pos1 - exit position in first room
        pos2 - exit position in second room

      • setDescriptions

        public void setDescriptions(String description1,

      • setLockedMessages

        public void setLockedMessages(String msg1,
                     String msg2)
        Sets the messages shown in the first and second room when the door is locked. These messages are shown in addition to the description.

      • setUnlockedMessages

        public void setUnlockedMessages(String msg1,
                       String msg2)
        Sets the messages shown in the first and second room when the door is unlocked. These messages are shown in addition to the description.

      • setNoKeyMessages

        public void setNoKeyMessages(String msg1,
                    String msg2)
        Sets the message shown when the player attempts to lock or unlock the door without holding the key, in room 1 and 2 respectively.

      • getKey

        public Entity getKey()
        Get the key needed to lock and unlock this door.
        Returns:
        the key entity, or null if no key is required

      • setKey

        public void setKey(Entity key)
        Sets the key needed to lock and unlock this door. The key is an Entity that must be in the player's inventory to perform these operations.
        Parameters:
        key - key entity, or null if no key is required
